header.title: How to deploy your site with the forrestbot via a cron job
header.abstract: This How-To describes the deployment of a forrest documentation with the help of the forrestbot. This deployment task will then be automated via a cron tab.

audience.title: Intended Audience
audience.p: Users who need to deploy a forrest documentation on a regular basis and want to automate this task.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.p: If you are administrate a forrest documentation and have to deploy it on a regular basis the process is sometimes quite time consuming. One feature of forrest is the forrestbot. This bot can build the documentation and later on deploy it to a server of your choice. You will learn how to use this forrestbot and how to mae programmed deployments.

ul.li: Understand how the forrestbot works in following the Forrestbot document.

section.title: Create your project's main sitemap.xmap
section.p: In the Forrestbot document you have seen an example of a buildfile for a cvs source. We will now use a local source.
section.source:
<project name="mysampleproject" default="main" > <property name="notify.email.host" value="smtp.example.org"/> <property name="notify.email.to" value="me@domain.com"/> <property name="notify.administrator" value="Your Name <me@domain.com>"/> <property name="getsrc.local.root-dir" value="/path/to/project/dir"/> <property name="deploy.scp.dest" value="user@deploy-host:/path/to/project/www-docs"/>
<!-- ant targets --> <target name="notify" depends="notify.local, notify.email"/> <target name="deploy" depends="deploy.scp"/> <target name="getsrc" depends="getsrc.local"/>
<!-- assumes FORREST_HOME has been set as an environment variable --> <property environment="env"/> <import file="${env.FORREST_HOME}/../forrestbot/core/forrestbot.xml"/> </project>
